main event: On October 7th, 1950, a luminous aerial object was observed over the island of Kauai, Hawaii for approximately 20 minutes. The object appeared to change in size and maintained the same angle of elevation above the horizon as it moved across the sky.
interesting points: The object first appeared 25 degrees above the horizon and was initially estimated to be about 6 times the diameter of the moon
The object's size changed during its course, appearing as brilliant white with a soft luminous white light
Initially mistaken for a shooting star, it was discounted due to its relatively slow speed and constant brilliance
The observer was a Lt Colonel, USAF
The weather conditions at the time of the sighting were not reported
